IRS990.Desc: WestRidge Senior Housing, Inc. provides housing with services to persons age 55 and older. Services that are provided free of charge include an activities program, a fitness program, transportation to outings, medical appointments and shopping, a daily continental breakfast, staffing 24/7 and chaplaincy. Services that are available at an additional cost include meals, beauty/barber shop, a guest suite and underground heated parking. There are also two laundry rooms on each floor. WestRidge Senior Housing, Inc. entered into an agreement with the City of Minnetonka, Minnesota in 1998, the year it opened, whereby 40% of the total apartment units would be rented to tenants whose income does not exceed 60% of the area median gross income, adjusted for family size, and the rent charged on these units cannot exceed 30% of this amount. The maximum monthly rent currently allowed under this restriction is $975 and $1,1754 for one-bedroom and two bedroom apartment units, respectively. Market rate rent for these same units is $1,346 and $1,691. The agreement is in effect through 2027.

Form990ScheduleAPartVIGrp.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Schedule A, Part III, Line 12, Explanation of Other Income:

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: The organization holds funds on behalf of its residents.

The Organization has been recognized by the Internal Revenue Service (IRS) as exempt from federal income taxes under Internal Revenue Code Section 501(c)(3). The Organization is annually required to file a Return of Organization Exempt from Income Tax (Form 990) with the IRS. In addition, the Organization is subject to income tax on net income that is derived from business activities that are unrelated to its exempt purpose. The Organization believes that it has appropriate support for any tax positions taken affecting its annual filing requirements, and, as such, does not have any uncertain tax positions that are material to the financial statements. The Organization would recognize future accrued interest and penalties related to unrecognized tax benefits and liabilities in income tax expense if such interest and penalties are incurred.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Section A, line 2
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: The Chief Executive Officer, Vice President of Finance, and Chief Operations Officer are employed by Avinity Services Company, a related tax exempt organization. John Kantke, John Bergeson, Fred Lund, and Nils Friberg are also board members of Avinity Services Company. Therefore, a business relationship exists between these individuals.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Section A, line 3
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: Avinity Services Company provides business management services and other support functions, including personnel, property, and financial management. The Chief Executive Officer, Vice President of Finance, and Chief Operations Officer are employed and compensated by Avinity Services Company. Refer to Part VII for compensation paid by the related organization.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Section A, line 6
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: The members of the Board of Directors of Avinity, Inc. shall be the only members of this organization.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Section A, line 7a
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: Three directors shall be appointed by the members of the organization. The other two directors shall be appointed by the Minnesota Iowa Baptist Conference.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Section A, line 8b
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: The Organization does not have any committees with the authority to act on behalf of the governing body.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, line 11b
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: Prior to the Form 990 being filed, it will be provided to all members of the Board of Directors for their review. It will also be reviewed by the Executive Director/COO.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, line 12c
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: The conflict of interest policy requires that all board members, officers, other volunteers and employees must fully disclose all areas of interest where potential conflict(s) may exist and that this disclosure should take place prior to any transactions being consummated. Transactions with parties with whom a conflicting interest does exist, may be undertaken only if all of the following are observed: 1. The person with the conflict of interest is excluded from the discussion and approval of such transaction; 2. A competitive bid or comparable valuation exists; and 3. The board, Chief Executive Officer or Vice President of Finance has determined that the transaction is in the best interest of the organization. To help ensure compliance with this policy, all board members and all employees are required to complete a conflict of interest disclosure statement, which are reviewed by the Chief Executive Officer or Vice President of Finance for indication of any potential conflicts of interest. If any material conflicts of interest are determined to exist, they are dealt with on a case by case basis and are brought to the Board of Director's attention, as appropriate.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, line 15
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: Compensation for the Chief Executive Officer and all other officers and key employees are determined by a related organization that has policies in place for determining compensation.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Section C, line 19
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: The financial statements are available upon request. The governing documents and conflict of interest policy may be made available on a case by case basis if requested.
The Board of Directors of Avinity, Inc. assumes responsibility for oversight of the audit of its financial statements and selection of an independent accountant.

DisregardedEntityName.BusinessNameLine1Txt: Shoreview Senior Residence dba Scandia Shores
Richfield Senior Housing Inc dba Mainstreet Vlg Senior Housing

RelatedOrganizationName.BusinessNameLine1Txt: Twin City Christian Homes Management Co Inc
